txt.en: It would seem Narchraw has indeed escaped Barad-dûr and perhaps escaped from Dor Amarth as well. At a dead end, you decide to examine your surroundings again in the hope that more information about Narchraw's destination surfaces.

'Narchraw has escaped then? This outcome may be the most favourable to all. It is very likely that Narchraw will return to his realm in Nan Ogol, the fell-vale in the far western reaches of Mordor. He may try to retake his former throne.'

You ask Lômazar about the creature known as Narchraw.

'It is difficult to explain in this tongue. He is neither man nor beast. He is both, yet something different.'
While you inspect the door, you hear footsteps coming around the corner
You notice that on your way into the chamber you forgot to inspect the door
Lômazar can be found at the Ruins of Díngarth.\n\nYou should speak with Lômazar.
Examine the chamber of Narchraw again
Barad-dûr is located in eastern Dor Amarth.\n\nYou should examine the chamber of Narchraw again.
Barad-dûr is located in eastern Dor Amarth.\n\nYou should examine the chamber of Narchraw again.
You should escape while Glúrugoth is incapacitated
At a dead end, you decide to inspect your surroundings again.
Escape Barad-dûr and fight off Glúrugoth's guards.

'Where is Narchraw?'

'Speak your purpose or die!

'Very well then!'
